result.execSummary:
The defendant Richard J. Beltoya III was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Richard J. Beltoya III is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Richard J. Beltoya III was found guilty of Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees. 
** Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
 Submit a DNA sample (unless previously provided).
** Pay DNA surcharges.   If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  DOC shall promptly notify the court of any new arrest or criminal charge made against the deff.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Richard J. Beltoya III

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Deceased
120 days KCJ - as a condition of probation.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  Special Pros K R Wells appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Greg Bates.  Atty Bates reports the deft is agreeable to the 120 days sanction/Living Free Program outlined in the agent's letter.  Deft sentenced to 120 days KCJ as a condition of probation for his violations.  Court takes no position on the Living Free program.
Atty  G Bates.
Clerk Lehman sent email to the PD's office regarding the deft's wish for PD representation as well as the new assigned court date

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody pro se.  Deft would like counsel.  RH set over to 10/12/15 @ 11:15am.  Deft instructed to get on the "call list" over at the jail in order to speak with the PD's office.  Order of the court holding deft in custody shall continue.
from Agent Matt Kaesermann
for Custody - deft to be held in custody pending further order of the court; NOTE - certified copy of order given to jail
For Ct 2 only - Dismissed.
Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge
placed on probation

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Andrea Rufo.  Warrant vacated.  Bond re-instated.  Sentencing arguments made.  Sentence w/held; placed on probation for three years.  See conditions.  Appeal rights.  If revoked, defense requests credit for two days.
Deft appeared @ 4pm; taken into custody.  Deft to be held without bond pending sentencing hrg on 8/11/15 @ 9:30am
warrant was not sent to Records (deft was put in custody at 4:15pm on 8/10/15 and returned to court on 8/11/15 @ 9:30am)

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Atty Andrea Rufo appeared on behalf of deft.  No appearance by deft.  NOTE - Clerk retrieved message from voice mail stating that he was running late due to a flat tire - wouldn't be here until 4:15pm - hrg originally scheduled for 3:30pm.  BW authorized; no bail.  In the event the deft appears, he shall be taken into custody pending another sentencing hrg on 8/11/15 @ 9:30am.
Sentencing hearing at 08-10-2015 03:30 pm (rescheduled due to ongoing jury trial)
Due to ongoing jury trial - sentencing hrg for 7/24/15 will be rescheduled.  Email sent to attys
Email received from Agent Sue Cole with attachment of a police report from 6/8/15.  Copy of email sent to ADA Krejcarek and Atty Andrea Rufo

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Rufo.  Sentencing hrg adj to 7/24/15 @ 10:15am; Court has not reviewed the PSI and Atty Rufo needs time to review the PSI w/her client.

Attorney Andrew Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty Andrea Rufo.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Count 2 - Dismissed on State motion.  Count 1 - Plea of guilty as a repeater; found guilty by the Court.  Updated presentence investigation ordered.  Sentencing 7/10/15 at 11:00.  Bond continued.
FPT adj to 5/28/15 @ 2:30pm - defense counsel out ill
Defense counsel out ill - FPT adj to 5/27/15 @ 9:30am
Final pre-trial on May 27, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  Special Pros K R Wells appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Andrea Rufo.  Defense moves for a short adjournment; deft needs time to review some documents.  FPT set for 5/6/15 @ 2pm, JS 6/15/15 @ 9am.
Plea hearing on April 20, 2015 at 01:15 pm.

Minutes:  NO RECORD TAKEN.  Clerk/T. Lema.  Special Pros K R Wells appeared for the State.  Atty Andrea Rufo appeared on behalf of deft.  Due to ongoing jury trial, deft not transported from the KCJ.  Plea hrg adj to 4/20/15 @ 1:15pm
Plea hearing on April 1, 2015 at 09:45 am.
Atty Rufo out ill; JS removed from the court's calendar
Defense counsel ill w/strep throat; FPT removed from the Court's calendar.  Leave on for JS for 3/9/15 @ 9am.  Defense counsel will notify the court if the case settles prior to the trial

Attorney Andrew Burgoyne appeared for the State. Def. appeared in court with Atty. Andrea Rufo. Clerk LE.  Plea offer placed on the record by the State.  Prelim. waived, probable cause found. Bound over to Br. 3. Information filed, plea of not guilty. Judicial pretrial on 2-19-15 @ 10:15am. Jury selection on 3-9-15 @ 9:00am. Bond continued.
